text.0: enjoy o agni this my fuel welcome the oilfilled ladle where we pour libation.
text.1: rise up for worship of the gods wise agni on the earths height while days are bright with beauty.
text.2: may he who goes before the gods come hither with steeds whose shapes are varied narasarhsa.
text.3: may he most godlike speed our offered viands with homage godward on the path of order.
text.4: men with oblations laud most constant agni and pray him to perform an envoys duty.
text.5: with lightlyrolling car and best draughthorses bring the gods hither and sit down as hotar.
text.6: may the delight of gods spread out transversely may it be with us long in length and fragrant.
text.7: o holy grass divine with friendly spirit bring thou the willing gods whose chief is indra.
text.8: touch ye the farextending height of heaven or spring apart to suit the wide earths measure.
text.9: yearning ye doors with those sublime in greatness seize eagerly the heavenly car that cometh.
text.10: here in this shrine may dawn and night the daughters of heaven the skilful goddesses be seated.
text.11: in your wide lap auspicious willing ladies may the gods seat them with a willing spirit.
text.12: up stands the stone high burns the fire enkindled aditis lap contains the friendly natures.
text.13: ye two chief priests who serve at this our worship may ye more skilled win for us rich possessions.
text.14: on our wide grass three goddesses be seated for you have we prepared and made it pleasant.
text.15: may iḷā she whose foot drops oil the goddess taste manlike sacrifice and wellset presents.
text.16: since thou god tvaṣṭar hast made beauty perfect since hou hast been the aṅgirases companion.
text.17: willing most wealthy giver of possessions grant us the gods assembly thou who knowest.
text.18: wellknowing binding with thy cord bring hither lord of the wood the deities assembly.
text.19: the god prepare and season our oblations may heaven and earth be gracious to my calling.
text.20: agni bring hither varuṇa to help us indra from heaven from airs midrealm the maruts.
text.21: on sacred grass all holy ones be seated and let the immortal gods rejoice in svāhā.
